etymology.description: Top: A representation of a room in a corridor -> Bottom: 夊 (suī, footprint pointing down) -> Original meaning: going back to meet people in a room -> Modern: return; repeat
etymology.interpretation: The character 复(復) (fù, 'return; repeat') combines a representation of a room in a corridor with 夊(夊) (suī, 'footprint pointing down'), highlighting the meaning of returning or going back, suggesting a movement back to a familiar or designated space.

examples.chinese: 请复述你的故事(請復述你的故事)。
examples.pinyin: qǐng fù shù nǐ de gù shì.

examples.chinese: 等你复来时(等你復來時)，我们一起庆祝(我們一起慶祝)。
examples.pinyin: děng nǐ fù lái shí, wǒ men yī qǐ qìng zhù.
examples.english: When you return, we will celebrate together.

examples.chinese: 复查后(復查後)，他发现问题依旧(他發現問題依舊)。
examples.pinyin: fù chá hòu, tā fā xiàn wèn tí yī jiù.
examples.english: After rechecking, he found the problems unchanged.
